questionsAndAnswers.question: What is the purpose of LoRA Caption custom nodes in ComfyUI?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: LoRA Caption custom nodes allow you to caption images, making them ready for LoRA training.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: LoRA Caption custom nodes

questionsAndAnswers.question: How do you access LoRA Caption custom nodes in ComfyUI?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: You can access LoRA Caption custom nodes by right-clicking and looking for the LJRE category, or by double-clicking an empty space and searching for 'caption'.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: LoRA Caption custom nodes

questionsAndAnswers.question: Which nodes are mandatory for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: WD 1.4 Tagger is mandatory for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI, as it is the one that does the captioning.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: Image-Captioning workflow

questionsAndAnswers.question: What is the function of the Load node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: The Load node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow has two jobs: feeding images to the tagger and getting the names of every image file in the folder.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: Load node

questionsAndAnswers.question: What is the function of the Save node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: The Save node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow creates text files with the image name as its own name and the description of the image as its content.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: Save node

questionsAndAnswers.question: Are Jjk custom nodes necessary for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: No, Jjk custom nodes are optional for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: Jjk custom nodes

questionsAndAnswers.question: For which types of images is WD 1.4 Tagger designed?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: WD 1.4 Tagger is designed for anime images, although it might also work for realistic images.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: WD 1.4 Tagger

questionsAndAnswers.question: What format should the images be in for the LoRA database in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: The images for the LoRA database in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow should be in png format.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: LoRA database

questionsAndAnswers.question: What should you do if text files already exist and ComfyUI throws an Out of Range error?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: If text files already exist, ComfyUI will throw an Out of Range error. To continue, make sure the text files don't exist already, or delete them and relaunch the workflow.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: Out of Range error

questionsAndAnswers.question: What does the common prefix in the widget of the Load node do?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: The common prefix in the widget of the Load node is useful for creating trigger words for your LoRA. If you use the widget, make sure it ends with a comma.
questionsAndAnswers.subject: Load node
